billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Establishes a tax credit for alternative energy systems and generating equipment
summary: Establishes an alternative energy systems and generating equipment tax credit for qualified expenditures meeting the criteria prescribed by the department of taxation and finance, in consultation with the department of environmental conservation and the New York state energy research and development authority, for taxpayers subject to tax under articles nine-a, twenty-two, thirty-two and thirty-three of the tax law whose business is not substantially engaged in the commercial generation, distribution, transmission or servicing of energy or energy products.

   22  MENT OR COMBINATION OF COMPONENTS UTILIZING SOLAR RADIATION  TO  PRODUCE
   23  ENERGY  DESIGNED  TO PROVIDE HEATING, COOLING, HOT WATER OR ELECTRICITY.
   24  SUCH ARRANGEMENT OR COMPONENTS SHALL NOT INCLUDE EQUIPMENT THAT IS  PART

   20  WATER,  GAS,  OR  OTHER  FLUIDS  ARTIFICIALLY INTRODUCED INTO GEOTHERMAL

   22    (III) HEAT OR OTHER ASSOCIATED ENERGY FOUND IN GEOTHERMAL  FORMATIONS;
   23  AND
   24    (IV)  ANY  BYPRODUCTS  DERIVED  FROM THEM, WHERE "BYPRODUCT" MEANS ANY

   48  ALS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

   50  RESPECT TO WHICH THE CREDIT MAY BE CLAIMED PURSUANT TO THE INITIAL CRED-
   51  IT  COMPONENT  CERTIFICATE  ISSUED  PURSUANT  TO SUBDIVISION (D) OF THIS

BILL NUMBER:S2483

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the tax law, in relation to establishing a tax
credit for alternative energy systems and generating equipment

PURPOSE:
The purpose of this legislation is to encourage the investment in and
continued use of alternative energy systems and generating equipment
through tax credits which will assist in offsetting the initial costs
of constructing and installing solar and wind energy system equipment
and fuel cell electric generating equipment.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 - would amend the tax law by adding a new section 28-a to
establish a tax credit for alternative energy systems and generating
equipment.

Subdivision a - would establish a tax credit for qualified
expenditures meeting the criteria prescribed by the Department of
Tax. and Finance in consultation with the Department of Environmental
Conservation and the New York State Energy Research and Development
Authority (NYSERDA) for taxpayers subject to tax under articles
nine-a, twenty-two, thirty-two and thirty-three whose business is not
substantially engaged in the commercial generation, distribution,
transmission or servicing of energy or energy products.

Subdivision b - would establish definitions for the following terms:
"solar and wind energy system equipment," solar electric generating
equipment, wind energy system, "fuel cell electric generating
equipment,", "farm waste electric generating equipment, "credit
allowance year-" "taxable year," and qualified expenditures.

Subdivision c - would allow for tax credits for qualifying energy
systems and equipment as follows:

Paragraph 1 - establishes qualified alternative energy systems and
generating equipment expenses.
Paragraph 2 - provides for tax credit for eligible solar and wind
energy system equipment equal to 50% of the qualified expenses for
certain taxpayers.
paragraph 3 - provides for tax credit for eligible fuel cell electric
generating equipment equal to 45% of the qualified expenses for
certain taxpayers.
Paragraph 4 - provides for proration of tax credit when two or more
taxpayers share in the accumulation of qualifying expenditures of
qualifying alternative systems and generating equipment.

Subdivision d - establishes requirements for tax credit qualification.
Paragraph 1 - provides for realization of credit.

Paragraph 2 - credit component Certificate from NYSERDA required.

Paragraph 3 - provides for NYSERDA issuance of Certificate marking
approval of qualifying expenses for application of tax credits.

Paragraph 4 - provides for revocation of Certificate upon violation of
terms of this paragraph or any willful misrepresentation of any terms
of this section.

Paragraph 5 - provides for recapture of current and previously
received benefits if Use of any solar and wind energy system
equipment or fuel cell electric generating is discontinued within 5
Years, but for certain circumstances.

Sections 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - amend the tax law to allow for alternative
energy systems and generating equipment credits, as would be
established pursuant to section one of this legislation, within
Articles nine-a, twenty-two, thirty-two and thirty-three of the tax
law.

Section 7 - Effective date.

EXISTING LAW:
A" personal income tax credit currently exists for individuals who
invest

in solar electric technologies for residential Use.

JUSTIFICATION:
The provision of a tax credit for business
corporations would encourage the
business community to invest in alternative energy systems. The
additional investment in solar energy and fuel cell electric
generating equipment would enhance the diversification of New
York's reliance on non-renewable technologies and help protect
our environment with cleaner energy sources.  A tax credit to
assist businesses in offsetting the cost of developing and
installing these self-sufficient and renewable energy systems
would provide the additional incentive for these businesses to
invest in such equipment thereby decreasing their need for
traditional energy sources.

It is estimated tax revenue would be reduced by $15 million
annually.
